div.head: 31.3.1885 Dienstag
div.p: Arrived here this afternoon. Directly went out from the Continental Hotel, where we had reserved some very good rooms by telegraph from Hamburg, to secure places for the torchlight procession in honour of Bismarck. Got very good place „Unter den Linden“ We dined at a Café Unter den Linden and afterwards went to our windows on the third story of a house. We could see everything very well. The procession lasted over an hour, and was very amusing especially the Cameroon niggers who were in one part of the procession. After the procession had passed aunt Lulu and I went down into the street and tried to get to the Wilhelm Strasse where Bismarcks Palace Reichskanzlerpalais is situated; But directly we got down we saw what a fearful crowd there was, and when we got as far as the Friedrichs Strasse another crowd was coming down from that street and trying to cross ours. It was stronger than the crowd we were in and the crash that followed can not be described: we were jolted and knocked and trod on so that it is a wonder we were not squeezed to a jelly. Aunt Lulu clung to me and from time to time gave a feeble squeak, till at last we managed to get into an apothecary’s shop where we bought something some Natron and were let out by the back door. From here we courageously again pushed forward to the Wilhelm Strasse and this time managed to get there by a back street. The smell there, occasioned by the burning torches which were lying about on the pavement, was dreadful. There was an electric light playing on to the Reichskanzleramt but nothing else much worth seeing afterwards home.
